quotes.quote: The increase in the world's population represents our victory against death.
In a saturated population life is always cheap.
Population pressure is the ultimate cause of every war.
Real problem is not population explosion, but what the population is doing.
The superior power of population cannot be checked without producing misery or vice.
In a region with a growing population, if you're doing nothing, you're losing ground.
It is the population which decides when it's time for a leader to leave, not foreign powers.
You cannot control your own population by force, but it can be distracted by consumption.
We all worry about the population explosion, but we don't worry about it at the right time.
Given continued high rates of population increase, all environmental victories are temporary.
Nature's standard operating procedure, pairing a population explosion with a population crash.
Technology made large populations possible; large populations now make technology indispensable.
The population problem has no technical solution; it requires a fundamental extension in morality.
The general population doesn't know what's happening, and it doesn't even know that it doesn't know.
Population, when unchecked, goes on doubling itself every 25 years or increases in a geometrical ratio.
The negative impact of population growth on all of our planetary ecosystems is becoming appallingly evident.
Population growth is exceeding farmers' ability to keep up...Our oldest enemy, hunger, is again at the door.
A finite world can support only a finite population; therefore, population growth must eventually equal zero.
Every segment of our population, and every individual, has a right to expect from his government a fair deal.
Population control is not an issue involving contraceptives for third world women. It is an issue of ecological justice.
Population growth and the proliferation of mega-cities around the world redefines the entire global security agenda.
There is a hugely underserved population out there... those who are the least capable of paying pay the highest.
When the population is filled with peace and harmony it ripens like fruit that turns to rot in a jiff if not preserved by change.
It's not about keeping up the population, it's about passing on who we are and what we've learned, so things keep going. So we don't just end.
A population that does not take care of the elderly and of children and the young has no future, because it abuses both its memory and its promise.
There would be no population explosion if people who are trying to keep the wolf from the door wouldn't let the stork fly in through the window.
Our population is headed for a stable plateau, which means an aging population.
A refugee population is hungry for language and aware that anything can happen.
The key thing you can do to reduce population growth is actually improve health.
The world's population will multiply more rapidly than the available food supply.
